oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Computations of laminar and turbulent mixed convection in a driven cavity using pseudo-compressibility approach
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: AGRAWAL, L
MANDAL, JC
MARATHE, AG
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: boundary conditions
mathematical models
turbulent flow
shear stress
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A driven cavity, for two different thermal boundary conditions, has been chosen as a test case to establish the suitability of the pseudo-compressibility algorithm for mixed convection flow problems for both laminar and turbulent flow situations. The shear stress transport eddy viscosity model has been modified to include the buoyancy effects. The flow is computed inside the cavity under the influence of varying buoyancy and inertia forces. The computed results demonstrate the ability of the pseudo-compressibility approach and shear stress transport model to solve complex heat transfer problems.
